revised_title: Accelerator Mass Spectrometry: Fundamentals and Applications
tldr: The article discusses the fundamentals of accelerator mass spectrometry, a technique that uses an additional stage of acceleration to remove molecular interferences and separate isobars. This ultra-high sensitivity method allows the measurement of isotope ratios at natural abundances as low as one atom in a billion. The author explains the principles, types of analyzers, and applications of accelerator mass spectrometry in various fields, such as archaeology, geophysics, and nuclear physics.
